text:
1:06
Oh, Starlight is "with" Trixie's sister
Oh... OH FUCK
author: @Hikouma

replies.text: This is Trixie. You can see the wings in the back.
replies.author: @slon_iz_mha_3

replies.text:
‚Äã@slon_iz_mha_3
That's her hair.
replies.author: @Hikouma

replies.text: ‚Äã¬†@Hikouma¬†What hair? These are wings in black clothes.
replies.author: @slon_iz_mha_3

replies.text:
‚Äã@slon_iz_mha_3 
Wait, didn't notice they were black. I'm gonna go ahead and say the black wings are just there to mirror Trixie's white wings as a form of symbolism. Yin and yang. The biggest indicator that it's Trixie's sister is the "Feminazi" getup, since she hates men. If you take a look at the previous image with Twi as well, then look at the one on question, the two of them appear to be looking at each other.
replies.author: @Hikouma

replies.text: ‚Äã@slon_iz_mha_3The first image is Trixie, the second is Mary.
replies.author: @yume5338

replies.text: ‚Äã¬†@yume5338¬†Mary has no wings.
replies.author: @slon_iz_mha_3

replies.text:
‚Äã@slon_iz_mha_3 Ooh I didn't notice those wings, good catch.  I still think that's Mary, though, because the way the mane and lines under her eyes are drawn are consistent with Mary and not Trixie.  There's also no horn and we see Starlight have a clear reaction to Mary on the stage and here she's on her back.

This definitely implies more to be shown, maybe she used to have wings or they're fake.
replies.author: @yume5338

replies.text:
Its absolutely Mary.
The eyes, the hat.. I think theres no doubt.

Also, seeing her with Starlight just fits perfectly. She's the other character to be most commonly shipped with Trixie.

Tamers knows how to choose the ships very very well.
